blog.name: wordscorrupt
blog.title: Iron Dad All Day Every Day
blog.description: Tony Stark, Steve Rogers and Peter Parker have taken over my life. I write stories and then cry over them.

summary: 5 Times Tony Kissed Peter on the Cheek (1/5)
title: 5 Times Tony Kissed Peter on the Cheek (1/5)
body:
i’M SORRY I COULDN’T STOP MYSELF ITS A PROBLEM OKAY?

warning: major domestic fluff

After May’s untimely introduction to her nephew’s superhero life (which led to the third time Tony came to genuinely fear for his life), Peter and Tony found themselves spending more time with each other due to May’s request that Tony keep a close eye on her nephew. What started as daily text messages and weekly phone calls quickly grew into Peter sleeping over at the compound every other weekend. And for the first time in his life, Tony found himself following a morning routine.

Peter let out a huge yawn, stretching his arms above his head as he staggered into the kitchen. Tony’s lips quirked as he glanced up momentarily at the teen before turning back to the pancakes because he was not going to be burning them for the second day in the row.

“Good morning, kiddo.”

Peter mumbled an incoherent greeting as he walked past Tony, absentmindedly scratching at his hair as he went to rummage through the fridge. Tony watched from the corner of his eye as the kid, still half asleep, struggled to untwist the cap on the milk, and he was quick to swipe the jug away from the teen. Peter offered him a truly offended look coupled with a pout that tugged at Tony’s heart.

“Go sit down before you destroy this kitchen. I’ll get you some milk, okay?” Tony placated the teen, placing the gallon of milk on the other side of him, far away from uncoordinated spider baby hands.

Peter grumbled softly but made his way to the kitchen island, taking a minute to hoist himself up onto one of the chairs. Tony watched with a careful eye, ready at a moment’s notice to grab the kid if it looked like he was going to take a tumble. Thankfully, the kid got himself settled onto the chair, offering a proud grin over at his mentor. Tony rolled his eyes fondly.

Peter sat quietly for a second before shuffling around in the pocket of his pajama pants for his phone, turning it on and starting to swipe through his notifications.

A few minutes later he jumped when a plate of pancakes stacked high appeared in front of him, followed by a bowl of fruit and lastly a glass of milk.

“Soup’s on, kiddo!” Tony exclaimed, planting a quick kiss to Peter’s cheek then shaking a can of whipped cream using it to decorate Peter’s pancakes with a lopsided smiley face.

“Mister Stark!” Peter giggled, rubbing at his cheek.  

“It talks!” Tony teased, ruffling the boy’s curls. Peter huffed, trying to hide his smile as the man walked over to grab his neglected mug of coffee.

“Better start eating before it gets cold,” Tony pointed out as he walked back, taking a seat in the chair next to Peter.

Peter grabbed his fork, cutting up his pancakes as the other moved to grab his phone so he could continue scrolling through it as he ate. That was until Tony reached over, swiping his phone away from him.

“Wha-?!” Peter squealed, reaching over to grab his phone but Tony just pocketed it instead.

“No phones while at the dining table,” Tony reminded him, taking a sip of his coffee before pointing at Peter’s plate, “Finish your food first, kiddo, and then you can get it back.”

Tony smirked as Peter let out a huff and for a minute it looked like the teen was going to argue before he picked up his fork and started eating, offering Tony a half heart glared.

Tony grinned, taking a sip of his coffee.

Yeah, he had this parenting thing down.

blog.name: tessasangeltom
blog.title: Bug
blog.description: There’s a lot of stuff on here Masterlist  Promptlist

title: Change My Mind (Chapter 8)
body:
Pairing: Peter Parker x reader

AU: Soulmate!AU

Warnings: Sucky written fluff, kissing

Word Count: 1353

Author’s Note:  Here’s chapter 8! I feel as though I didn’t put enough fluffy moments in the previous chapter for the connection to be united like this, sorry! Im going to put next to the title of the story on my masterlist that it has slow updates. Im sorry. Asks are open though, for rants, questions, blurbs, and or submissions! A NSFW Alphabet for Harry is gonna be posted tonight. Love you all ♥

After school, Y/n went to the front of the building to wait for Peter like he said to. She saw the entire student body pour out of the school and she tried standing on the tips of her toes to find the brunette in a blue sweater but he was too hard to find. Until she felt a quick spark on her fingers.

She turned around and saw Peter grabbing her hand trying to get her attention. She smiled at him then down at the grip he had on her. Peter noticed how long he was holding her hand and how long the spark was lasting so he pulled away quickly. A dark shade of red appeared on his cheeks and he avoided her gaze.

A frown grew on Y/n’s face when he pulled away but she replaced it with a small smile before he could notice, “So should we go?”

“Yeah yeah. But um, just to let you know, Ned is coming over soon so him and I can work on something together. I hope that’s cool.” Peter looked at Y/n while rubbing the back of his neck with the hand he grabbed her with. He still avoided her gaze which caused Y/n to become a little suspicious of what he was saying.

“So, its gonna be you, me and Ned then?” Y/n was a bit upset that it wasn’t going to be only her and Peter but she put it aside rather than dwell on it.

“Well, me and Ned have something really important to work on. Privately. But I mean we can continue on with the stuff tomorrow. Its going to be Saturday so we would have more time in the day tomorrow.” Peter didn’t want to hurt her feelings but him and Ned really needed to know where the guys from last night were going.

At this point, Y/n and Peter were on the crowded train as the conversation continued. Y/n looked into Peter’s eyes and was about to reply until the train came to an abrupt stop. The force caused Y/n to stumbled and fall onto Peter chest. With Peter’s enhanced balanced, he didn’t need to grab onto the pole but instead he put his hands on Y/n waist to hold her.

The closed space between their bodies had them both blushing when they looked at eachother. Y/n placed her hands onto his chest to take a step back but Peter squeezed her sides gently then removed them after. It wasn’t just a small spark that showed up when they touched, this time it was more strong vibration going through their bodies that had their hearts pumping.

Y/n took a step back as much as she could in the crowded train and looked away from Peter. Neither knew what to say, the previous conversation taking an end. The rest of the train ride was silent until they got to Peter’s stop. Walking from the station to his house, neither looked at the other in the eye.

With the quiet journey home, Peter didn’t expect her to ask him about the decathlon situation when they settled in his room, “I heard you dropped out the decathlon team. Why?”

Pulling their materials out their bags, Peter hesitated to answer, “Well, the Stark internship. It takes up alot of time after school and on the weekends so I barely have time to do anything other than school.”

“But you have time for me.”

Peter looked over at Y/n sitting on his bed, she was waiting for a reply to her comment but he didn’t know what to say so he nodded and agreed, “Yeah, i do.”

“Why?” Y/n was eager to know the answer, heart beating harder the longer he took to say something.

Peter sat on the bed next to her with a textbook and notebook in his hands. His placement had the side of their thighs and knees touching. He coughed lightly before opening the algebra textbook in his hand, “Not sure, I just…”

He looked at her in the eyes, seeming to be the most gentle things he had ever seen in his life. She was looking back at his brown eyes and bit her lip. Neither knew, but both of their hearts swelled in their chest while holding the other’s gaze, “You what?”

Slowly, Peter went from looking at her eyes to her lips then back up. “I just did.” Almost shaking from nerves, Peter started leaning forward when suddenly the door open. Aunt May was standing at the door with a basket of laundry in her hands.

“Oh shit. Sorry Peter. I didn’t know you had a girl over. Hi I’m May. Peter’s aunt.” She looked quickly at Peter who gave her an annoyed look.

Y/n was still flustered from their previous actions before May walked in and took a moment to register what she said, “Oh um. Hi, Im Y/n.”

“Oh you’re Y/n. Wow Peter, when you said she was beautiful, you weren’t kidding.” Freaking out at her comment, Peter silently begged for May to walk out the room.

Through almost closed lips, Peter tried getting his aunt to leave, “Aunt May. I didn’t say that.”

Y/n looked at him with her eyebrows raised not knowing what to say. He looked at her and saw Y/n’s expression change from shocked to hurt, “No. I mean I did. You are beautiful. But like, Aunt May wasn’t supposed to say anything.”

Peter gave his aunt another annoyed look and that’s when she finally took the cue to leave.

“Okay, Im going to order some food. Pizza tonight? Pizza it is.” With that, she left the room, leaving the bedroom door slightly open ajar.

Peter looked back at Y/n and sighed in relief.

“I’m sorry about that. Sometimes she can get a bit…”

“Much?”

“Yeah. Much is the word. Should we uh, get back to algebra though?” Peter glanced back and forth from her face and to the textbook that was still placed back on his lap. Y/n bit her lip again and Peter sucked in a breath when he saw.

“Well we never really started did we. You were about to kiss me.” Please kiss me.

Her words were as effective to his actions as candy was to a child; exciting and strong. The change in the amount of tension almost caused Y/n to take back her words but before she could, she felt Peter’s lips on hers.

They were soft against hers; eager yet slow, gentle with the movements but unrestrained with the passion.

Not knowing what to do next, her hands moved the notebook on her laps to the floor. She fixed her position sitting next to him without breaking the connection to their lips. Her hands went to his head and pulled at the hair in the nape of his neck.

Too soon, both of them disconnected their lips to catch their breaths. She leaned her forehead on his and smiled. Pulling away, Peter didn’t want to let go of her. His hands did not remove themselves from her waist, instead pulling her even closer, “Hi.”

She laughed lightly and leaned her head on his shoulder, “Hi Peter.”

“I’m sorry I distracted you.” He leaned his cheek on her head and sighed. Relief flushed over them both, stomachs stopped churning but heart rates increased. She laughed again before nudging him on the side with his elbow, “Its okay. I liked the distraction. But I guess this means you know I like you?”

He gave her a really? look and they both started laughing. Having one arm around her, he pulled her as close as he could.

With their feelings established and work still in front of them, they decided to start actually doing what needed to be done. Peter went over the lessons she didn’t understand and believe it or not, he was a good teacher. A teacher that would squeeze her side or kiss her cheek every time she got something right.

~~~

Author’s Note:  Here’s chapter 8! I feel as though I didn’t put enough fluffy moments in the previous chapter for the connection to be united like this, sorry! Im going to put next to the title of the story on my masterlist that it has slow updates. Im sorry. Asks are open though, for rants, questions, blurbs, and or submissions! A NSFW Alphabet for Harry is gonna be posted tonight. Love you all ♥

After school, Y/n went to the front of the building to wait for Peter like he said to. She saw the entire student body pour out of the school and she tried standing on the tips of her toes to find the brunette in a blue sweater but he was too hard to find. Until she felt a quick spark on her fingers.

She turned around and saw Peter grabbing her hand trying to get her attention. She smiled at him then down at the grip he had on her. Peter noticed how long he was holding her hand and how long the spark was lasting so he pulled away quickly. A dark shade of red appeared on his cheeks and he avoided her gaze.

A frown grew on Y/n’s face when he pulled away but she replaced it with a small smile before he could notice, “So should we go?”

“Yeah yeah. But um, just to let you know, Ned is coming over soon so him and I can work on something together. I hope that’s cool.” Peter looked at Y/n while rubbing the back of his neck with the hand he grabbed her with. He still avoided her gaze which caused Y/n to become a little suspicious of what he was saying.

“So, its gonna be you, me and Ned then?” Y/n was a bit upset that it wasn’t going to be only her and Peter but she put it aside rather than dwell on it.

“Well, me and Ned have something really important to work on. Privately. But I mean we can continue on with the stuff tomorrow. Its going to be Saturday so we would have more time in the day tomorrow.” Peter didn’t want to hurt her feelings but him and Ned really needed to know where the guys from last night were going.

At this point, Y/n and Peter were on the crowded train as the conversation continued. Y/n looked into Peter’s eyes and was about to reply until the train came to an abrupt stop. The force caused Y/n to stumbled and fall onto Peter chest. With Peter’s enhanced balanced, he didn’t need to grab onto the pole but instead he put his hands on Y/n waist to hold her.

The closed space between their bodies had them both blushing when they looked at eachother. Y/n placed her hands onto his chest to take a step back but Peter squeezed her sides gently then removed them after. It wasn’t just a small spark that showed up when they touched, this time it was more strong vibration going through their bodies that had their hearts pumping.

Y/n took a step back as much as she could in the crowded train and looked away from Peter. Neither knew what to say, the previous conversation taking an end. The rest of the train ride was silent until they got to Peter’s stop. Walking from the station to his house, neither looked at the other in the eye.

With the quiet journey home, Peter didn’t expect her to ask him about the decathlon situation when they settled in his room, “I heard you dropped out the decathlon team. Why?”

Pulling their materials out their bags, Peter hesitated to answer, “Well, the Stark internship. It takes up alot of time after school and on the weekends so I barely have time to do anything other than school.”

“But you have time for me.”

Peter looked over at Y/n sitting on his bed, she was waiting for a reply to her comment but he didn’t know what to say so he nodded and agreed, “Yeah, i do.”

“Why?” Y/n was eager to know the answer, heart beating harder the longer he took to say something.

Peter sat on the bed next to her with a textbook and notebook in his hands. His placement had the side of their thighs and knees touching. He coughed lightly before opening the algebra textbook in his hand, “Not sure, I just…”

He looked at her in the eyes, seeming to be the most gentle things he had ever seen in his life. She was looking back at his brown eyes and bit her lip. Neither knew, but both of their hearts swelled in their chest while holding the other’s gaze, “You what?”

Slowly, Peter went from looking at her eyes to her lips then back up. “I just did.” Almost shaking from nerves, Peter started leaning forward when suddenly the door open. Aunt May was standing at the door with a basket of laundry in her hands.

“Oh shit. Sorry Peter. I didn’t know you had a girl over. Hi I’m May. Peter’s aunt.” She looked quickly at Peter who gave her an annoyed look.

Y/n was still flustered from their previous actions before May walked in and took a moment to register what she said, “Oh um. Hi, Im Y/n.”

“Oh you’re Y/n. Wow Peter, when you said she was beautiful, you weren’t kidding.” Freaking out at her comment, Peter silently begged for May to walk out the room.

Through almost closed lips, Peter tried getting his aunt to leave, “Aunt May. I didn’t say that.”

Y/n looked at him with her eyebrows raised not knowing what to say. He looked at her and saw Y/n’s expression change from shocked to hurt, “No. I mean I did. You are beautiful. But like, Aunt May wasn’t supposed to say anything.”

Peter gave his aunt another annoyed look and that’s when she finally took the cue to leave.

“Okay, Im going to order some food. Pizza tonight? Pizza it is.” With that, she left the room, leaving the bedroom door slightly open ajar.

Peter looked back at Y/n and sighed in relief.

“I’m sorry about that. Sometimes she can get a bit…”

“Much?”

“Yeah. Much is the word. Should we uh, get back to algebra though?” Peter glanced back and forth from her face and to the textbook that was still placed back on his lap. Y/n bit her lip again and Peter sucked in a breath when he saw.

“Well we never really started did we. You were about to kiss me.” Please kiss me.

Her words were as effective to his actions as candy was to a child; exciting and strong. The change in the amount of tension almost caused Y/n to take back her words but before she could, she felt Peter’s lips on hers.

They were soft against hers; eager yet slow, gentle with the movements but unrestrained with the passion.

Not knowing what to do next, her hands moved the notebook on her laps to the floor. She fixed her position sitting next to him without breaking the connection to their lips. Her hands went to his head and pulled at the hair in the nape of his neck.

Too soon, both of them disconnected their lips to catch their breaths. She leaned her forehead on his and smiled. Pulling away, Peter didn’t want to let go of her. His hands did not remove themselves from her waist, instead pulling her even closer, “Hi.”

She laughed lightly and leaned her head on his shoulder, “Hi Peter.”

“I’m sorry I distracted you.” He leaned his cheek on her head and sighed. Relief flushed over them both, stomachs stopped churning but heart rates increased. She laughed again before nudging him on the side with his elbow, “Its okay. I liked the distraction. But I guess this means you know I like you?”

He gave her a really? look and they both started laughing. Having one arm around her, he pulled her as close as he could.

With their feelings established and work still in front of them, they decided to start actually doing what needed to be done. Peter went over the lessons she didn’t understand and believe it or not, he was a good teacher. A teacher that would squeeze her side or kiss her cheek every time she got something right.

~~~

summary: Heroes Never Die ~Peter Parker x reader
body:
Heroes Never Die ~Peter Parker x reader

Not my gif.

Prompt: Reader is a healer and she uses the last of her energy to revive him and her last words are “I love you,I’m sorry. Please win for me.”

Callsign:Mercy, a healer who can revive people.

Y/N was in the base listening to the battle comms. She had used to much of her energy so she retreated to base. “Mr.Stark I need help. He’s really strong."A voice said. It was Peter. Y/N immediately panicked and put her suit on."JARVIS record. Hey guys Its Mercy aka Y/N. I’m sorry if I don’t make it back. Thank you for everything."She said as she leaped out the window and flew to the battle. ‘Peter just hold on for a little longer I’m almost there.'She thought as she arrived just in time to see him die. The person he was fighting left.

She flew down to him.”Heroes Never Die.“ She used the last of her energy to revive him before collapsing onto the ground.

"I-I’m alive?"He said. He immediately turned around to the female on the ground.

"Peter, I love you. I’m sorry. Please win for me."She said before darkness consumed her and she was gone.

summary: OH MY GOD! You're fanfiction sounds amazing!!  pleassseeee can I have a sneak peek?
question: OH MY GOD! You're fanfiction sounds amazing!!  pleassseeee can I have a sneak peek?
answer:
Since you asked so nicely, here’s a quick sneak peek, this is just after Tony has returned home from Afghanistan in Iron Man:

Tony nuzzled his face into Peter’s hair as he spun around and took in the familiarity of his home, “Hello Jarvis.”

“Welcome home, sir.” Jarvis said quieter than usual.

“Home.” Tony said softly still leaning into his son, “Let’s get you to bed, young man.”

Peter sleepily moved his head closer to Tony’s neck seeking the intimacy they had both been deprived of, the connection that had cruelly been ripped away from them for three months. “Okay.” Peter uttered under his breath, “Bed time.”

A quiet unsure chuckle erupted from Tony’s throat as he started the walk up towards Peter’s room; he knew he’d fought to come home but he was still afraid that he was going to wake up and be back in the cave, miles away from his son. Though, Peter’s tight grip and utterly unique mannerisms were proof that Tony was home.

Tony helped a semi-conscious Peter clean his teeth and change into his Star Wars pyjamas, he pushed back the covers as he lifted him up and lay him down, making sure he was comfortable. He brushed his hand through his hair and leaned over, planting a kiss on his forehead before standing up, “Love you.”

“To the moon and back.” Peter mumbled into his pillow as he curled his legs close to his chest.

body:
meeting tom

  • you were a teacher at paddy’s primary school when you first met
  • Tom had come to pick him up, and since it was the first time he had you legally had to go out and greet him to make sure it was someone paddy knew
  • Safety protocol and all
  • Tom found himself asking if he could pick up his brother just so he could see you again
  • And eventually he asked if he could take you to dinner
  • And you were hesitant at first, because you were his younger brothers teacher
  • But he convinced you, and you found yourself sat across from him later that week
  • It was the best date you had been on, not that you dated a lot
  • Tom was perfect, a real gentlemen but not to the point where he seemed plain boring
  • the dates became more frequent, and you both decided that maybe you should put a name to it
  • And that’s how you met your boyfriend, Tom Holland

  • And that’s how you met your boyfriend, Tom Holland

blog.description:
Desi. 18. she/her. All things Marvel and Irondad. 

Inbox & dms are open 25/7.

summary: Take me to my home (These tired eyes just want to remain closed)
title: Take me to my home (These tired eyes just want to remain closed)
body:
Chapter 1/3, Words: 1452 
Here you can find chapter two!

 “You feeling alright there, kid?”

Peter looks up with an involuntary flinch and drops his hand from where he’s been holding his stomach. “Huh?”, he asks, before giving Tony a wide smile. “Oh yeah, Mr. Stark, I’m fine! Just a little tired is all.”

Normally, Peter wouldn’t admit into being tired this easily, especially when he was spending the weekend at the Avengers facility, but the dull pain in his upper abdomen had caught him off guard. Tony narrowed his eyes at him.

“You don’t have enough gray hair to be tired this early”, he reached over the table and ruffled Peters hair playfully. “You been out past your bedtime again?”

“No- No, I just, y'know, spider-manning and finals, it’s all very… tiring.” he finishes lamely and drops his gaze when he immediately feels his cheeks heat up. Tony just makes an affirming noise, looking at the boy with fondness in his gaze.

Tony leans back in his chair, leaving whatever tech he has been meddling with on the table and stretches.

“Well, maybe we should wrap up for tonight, what do you think?”, not expecting an answer, he addresses FRIDAY. “FRI, how’s dinner looking? All done up there?”

“The pizza Captain Rogers ordered will arrive in approximately 3 minutes, Boss. I’d advise making your way upstairs if you and Mister Parker want to save yourself a slice.”

Tony claps his hands together and rises from his seat. “You heard the woman, kid. Let’s move before these savages don’t leave anything for us. You hungry?”

“Always.” Peter lies as Mr Stark puts a hand on his back and steers him out of the lab. Especially with his metabolism he did feel hungry most of the time, but today his stomach just wasn’t having it. At least the pain in his gut had quietened down for now, so he let Tony lead him into the common area.

The Avengers, minus Clint and Natasha who were on a mission for SHIELD and Thor who was in Asgard, were already gathered in the living room when they entered. Peter was used to the dozens of pizza cartons by now and usually one of the first to dig in, but today his stomach just gave an unsatisfied growl and he swallowed heavily.

Peter eventually settled for a piece of hawaii pizza and retreated on the couch next to Wanda.

Over time he had gotten used to being around the Avengers, even though there was always this little voice in the back of his head that went “Oh my god, it’s the Avengers” when Thor gave him a pat on the back or Steve called him “son”.

“What’s with the spider-kid?”, Sam asks from across the room, throwing an empty water bottle in Peter’s general direction. “Oi, Spiderbaby, you falling asleep on us?”

Tony looked up from his conversation with Bruce, frowning at the unusual quietness coming from his kid whose mouth usually ran a mile a minute. Now he was sitting hunched over on the couch, looking unusually pale and clammy.

“Kid, you alright?” he asked and Peter looked up from his untouched piece of Pizza.

“Huh? Uh, yeah, yeah, I’m fine”, he rubbed a hand over his eyes, placing his pizza on the table and his other arm came up to hold his stomach. “Just… Exhausted, I guess?”

Tony frowned. “You sure? You want to turn in early?”

Peter looked hesitant, but Wanda butted into the conversation. “You do look tired”, she decided, looking the boy over with observant eyes. “We can always postpone the movie to tomorrow?”

Fully expecting the kid to recline, Tony was more than surprised when Peter eventually did give a tired little nod and heaved himself up from the couch, leaving his barely touched pizza behind.

He said goodnight to the team and shuffled out of the living room, Tony looking after him with a worried frown. The kid was always so eager to spend time at the compound, especially around the other Avengers, so for him to actually turn in this early was a little worrying.

Tony eventually finished his pizza and the team slowly dispersed. He thought about going back into the lab, but eventually decided to turn in early as well after asking FRIDAY to check on the kid.Tony woke up three hours later to the voice of FRIDAY demanding his attention.

“Is it Peter?” he asks, voice still rough with sleep as he swung his legs over the edge of the bed.

“Yes, boss.” she affirms and that’s all it takes for Tony to hurry down the hall to Peter’s room. The kid’s not in bed, but the door to the bathroom is cracked and Tony turns on the light.

“Kid?” he opens the door to find Peter on the ground. He’s hugging the toilet bowl, face only inches from the seat and his skin glistening with sweat under the bright bathroom light. Tony hurries across the room when Peter raises his head and turns to look at him with red-rimmed eyes.

“Mr Stark?”, he mutters, blinking up at the older man crouching besides him. “What are you doin’ here?” 

Peter splutters and Tony quickly guides his head back over the toilet bowl before Peter coughs and spits bile into the toilet. He quickly presses his palm to the kid’s neck, then feels his forehead and his cheek with the back of his hand.

“Well, you are definitely running a fever”, he asses, dropping his palm from Peter’s face and letting his other hand rest on the kid’s back. “FRIDAY told me you were in a bit of distress. By the way, FRI, you wanna get a reading on the kid’s temp?”

“Mr Parker’s temperature reads approximately 100.7°Fahrenheit, boss”, she answered. “His symptoms are similar to those of a stomach bug.”

Tony clicked his tongue and rubbed the kid’s back. “Yeah, I’d say so too.”

Peter let out a small groan, dropping his head over the bowl again. Tony felt his heart clench with sympathy and moved his hand up to the kid’s neck, applying what he hoped was a comforting kind of pressure.

“You want to move the party back to your room? Or stay here for another minute?” he asked.

“M'not sure”, Peter muttered, the hand that was not holding onto the toilet bowl coming up to cage his stomach. “Still feel really nauseous, y'know?”

Tony nodded and looked around the room for a solution that didn’t involve being jammed into the comparatively small bathroom for the rest of the night while still kneading his fingers into the skin of Peter’s neck in hopes of bringing some relieve to the kid.

“Tell you what, we move you back to bed and take a bucket, yeah? That way you don’t have to get up if you need to hurl again.” he suggested and for a moment Peter looked like he might protest, but then he slumped down again and just nodded at his mentor.

Tony took this as his cue and heaved himself up on aching muscles to help Peter straighten up. He snuck an arm around the kid’s torso and threw Peter’s arm over his own shoulder. 

“Alright, up we go.”Tony helped Peter stand and waited for him to regain his balance before slowly shuffling towards the kid’s room. Tony quickly took the waste bin from under the sink along and put it down next to the bed.

“Okay”, Tony sat Peter down on the bed and the kid clumsily climbed under the covers while Tony took a seat on the edge of the bed, a worried frown on his face. “There.”

In an automated action he brushed Peter’s hair away from his face and felt his forehead again, letting out an unsatisfied hum. 

“FRIDAY, can you take Peter’s temperature again?”

A second passed before the AI answered. “His temperature is still at 100.7° Fahrenheit, boss. It hasn’t changed since you last asked me 10 minutes ago.”

Tony glared at the ceiling halfheartedly, but it brought him a small chuckle from Peter so he turned back to the kid with his hand still resting on his head.

“It’s alright, Mr Stark”, he muttered, eyes already fluttering shut again but his face still two shades too pale. “Probably just the pizza. I’ll be fine tomorrow.”

“That’s what you get for eating pineapple on pizza.”

Peter snickered tiredly and Tony smirked at the teenage boy before running a hand through his hair a last time. “Night, Pete.”

Tony thought he heard Peter hum an answer into his pillow, but was already closing the door to the bedroom and then retreated back to his own room. 

Hopefully his kid would be better in the morning.


My very tiny, very cute taglist of very tiny, very cute people:
@toomuchtoread33 @baloobird

“Yes, boss.” she affirms and that’s all it takes for Tony to hurry down the hall to Peter’s room. The kid’s not in bed, but the door to the bathroom is cracked and Tony turns on the light.

“Kid?” he opens the door to find Peter on the ground. He’s hugging the toilet bowl, face only inches from the seat and his skin glistening with sweat under the bright bathroom light. Tony hurries across the room when Peter raises his head and turns to look at him with red-rimmed eyes.

“Mr Stark?”, he mutters, blinking up at the older man crouching besides him. “What are you doin’ here?” 

Peter splutters and Tony quickly guides his head back over the toilet bowl before Peter coughs and spits bile into the toilet. He quickly presses his palm to the kid’s neck, then feels his forehead and his cheek with the back of his hand.

“Well, you are definitely running a fever”, he asses, dropping his palm from Peter’s face and letting his other hand rest on the kid’s back. “FRIDAY told me you were in a bit of distress. By the way, FRI, you wanna get a reading on the kid’s temp?”

“Mr Parker’s temperature reads approximately 100.7°Fahrenheit, boss”, she answered. “His symptoms are similar to those of a stomach bug.”

Tony clicked his tongue and rubbed the kid’s back. “Yeah, I’d say so too.”

Peter let out a small groan, dropping his head over the bowl again. Tony felt his heart clench with sympathy and moved his hand up to the kid’s neck, applying what he hoped was a comforting kind of pressure.

“You want to move the party back to your room? Or stay here for another minute?” he asked.

“M'not sure”, Peter muttered, the hand that was not holding onto the toilet bowl coming up to cage his stomach. “Still feel really nauseous, y'know?”

Tony nodded and looked around the room for a solution that didn’t involve being jammed into the comparatively small bathroom for the rest of the night while still kneading his fingers into the skin of Peter’s neck in hopes of bringing some relieve to the kid.

“Tell you what, we move you back to bed and take a bucket, yeah? That way you don’t have to get up if you need to hurl again.” he suggested and for a moment Peter looked like he might protest, but then he slumped down again and just nodded at his mentor.

Tony took this as his cue and heaved himself up on aching muscles to help Peter straighten up. He snuck an arm around the kid’s torso and threw Peter’s arm over his own shoulder. 

“Alright, up we go.”Tony helped Peter stand and waited for him to regain his balance before slowly shuffling towards the kid’s room. Tony quickly took the waste bin from under the sink along and put it down next to the bed.

“Okay”, Tony sat Peter down on the bed and the kid clumsily climbed under the covers while Tony took a seat on the edge of the bed, a worried frown on his face. “There.”

In an automated action he brushed Peter’s hair away from his face and felt his forehead again, letting out an unsatisfied hum. 

“FRIDAY, can you take Peter’s temperature again?”

A second passed before the AI answered. “His temperature is still at 100.7° Fahrenheit, boss. It hasn’t changed since you last asked me 10 minutes ago.”

Tony glared at the ceiling halfheartedly, but it brought him a small chuckle from Peter so he turned back to the kid with his hand still resting on his head.

“It’s alright, Mr Stark”, he muttered, eyes already fluttering shut again but his face still two shades too pale. “Probably just the pizza. I’ll be fine tomorrow.”

“That’s what you get for eating pineapple on pizza.”

Peter snickered tiredly and Tony smirked at the teenage boy before running a hand through his hair a last time. “Night, Pete.”

Tony thought he heard Peter hum an answer into his pillow, but was already closing the door to the bedroom and then retreated back to his own room. 

Hopefully his kid would be better in the morning.

Here you can find chapter two!

 “You feeling alright there, kid?”

Peter looks up with an involuntary flinch and drops his hand from where he’s been holding his stomach. “Huh?”, he asks, before giving Tony a wide smile. “Oh yeah, Mr. Stark, I’m fine! Just a little tired is all.”

Normally, Peter wouldn’t admit into being tired this easily, especially when he was spending the weekend at the Avengers facility, but the dull pain in his upper abdomen had caught him off guard. Tony narrowed his eyes at him.

“You don’t have enough gray hair to be tired this early”, he reached over the table and ruffled Peters hair playfully. “You been out past your bedtime again?”

“No- No, I just, y'know, spider-manning and finals, it’s all very… tiring.” he finishes lamely and drops his gaze when he immediately feels his cheeks heat up. Tony just makes an affirming noise, looking at the boy with fondness in his gaze.

Tony leans back in his chair, leaving whatever tech he has been meddling with on the table and stretches.

“Well, maybe we should wrap up for tonight, what do you think?”, not expecting an answer, he addresses FRIDAY. “FRI, how’s dinner looking? All done up there?”

“The pizza Captain Rogers ordered will arrive in approximately 3 minutes, Boss. I’d advise making your way upstairs if you and Mister Parker want to save yourself a slice.”

Tony claps his hands together and rises from his seat. “You heard the woman, kid. Let’s move before these savages don’t leave anything for us. You hungry?”

“Always.” Peter lies as Mr Stark puts a hand on his back and steers him out of the lab. Especially with his metabolism he did feel hungry most of the time, but today his stomach just wasn’t having it. At least the pain in his gut had quietened down for now, so he let Tony lead him into the common area.

The Avengers, minus Clint and Natasha who were on a mission for SHIELD and Thor who was in Asgard, were already gathered in the living room when they entered. Peter was used to the dozens of pizza cartons by now and usually one of the first to dig in, but today his stomach just gave an unsatisfied growl and he swallowed heavily.

Peter eventually settled for a piece of hawaii pizza and retreated on the couch next to Wanda.

Over time he had gotten used to being around the Avengers, even though there was always this little voice in the back of his head that went “Oh my god, it’s the Avengers” when Thor gave him a pat on the back or Steve called him “son”.

“What’s with the spider-kid?”, Sam asks from across the room, throwing an empty water bottle in Peter’s general direction. “Oi, Spiderbaby, you falling asleep on us?”

Tony looked up from his conversation with Bruce, frowning at the unusual quietness coming from his kid whose mouth usually ran a mile a minute. Now he was sitting hunched over on the couch, looking unusually pale and clammy.

“Kid, you alright?” he asked and Peter looked up from his untouched piece of Pizza.

“Huh? Uh, yeah, yeah, I’m fine”, he rubbed a hand over his eyes, placing his pizza on the table and his other arm came up to hold his stomach. “Just… Exhausted, I guess?”

Tony frowned. “You sure? You want to turn in early?”

Peter looked hesitant, but Wanda butted into the conversation. “You do look tired”, she decided, looking the boy over with observant eyes. “We can always postpone the movie to tomorrow?”

Fully expecting the kid to recline, Tony was more than surprised when Peter eventually did give a tired little nod and heaved himself up from the couch, leaving his barely touched pizza behind.

He said goodnight to the team and shuffled out of the living room, Tony looking after him with a worried frown. The kid was always so eager to spend time at the compound, especially around the other Avengers, so for him to actually turn in this early was a little worrying.
